label: 花喰鳥
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 57th  . Nara National Museum . 2005
説明文: A motif of a bird carrying a branch of flowers in its beak, variations on which first appeared in Sassanian and Byzantine art. This motif traveled across Central Asia, through China, and into Japan via the Silk Road and is visible on numerous treasures in the Shōsō-in. See also Ganjucho.　[正倉院、含綬鳥]
